thread.title: Maybe Aaron Hernandez shouldn't call Mike Pouncey anymore
thread.title_full: Maybe Aaron Hernandez shouldn't call Mike Pouncey anymore

author: KEVIN ARMSTRONG
title: Maybe Aaron Hernandez shouldn't call Mike Pouncey anymore
text:
Aaron Hernandez phone calls with Mike Pouncey could help prove ex-Patriots tight end responsible for double murder: prosecutors Maybe Aaron Hernandez shouldn't call Mike Pouncey anymore Former Patriot Aaron Hernandez probably should make less phone calls. (Angela Rowlings/AP)  27 PM 
Aaron Hernandez might want to hang up the prison phone moving forward. 
Massachusetts prosecutors filed court documents Wednesday that include phone transcripts of Hernandez speaking with former University of Florida teammate Mike Pouncey about what the Commonwealth contends may help convict Hernandez in his upcoming double homicide trial. 
Jury selection is ongoing for the trial that is scheduled to open on March 1, but the court documents highlight conversations between Hernandez, who has previously been convicted for the murder of Odin Lloyd, and Pouncey, also an NFL player. 
Prosecutors pointed to one phone call on April 3, 2015 and stated that Hernandez felt he was being "tried" or tested by clubgoers in Boston. 
Alexander Bradley, a former Hernandez associate who was with Hernandez the night of the alleged murders, is expected to testify that Hernandez felt disrespected by Safiro Furtado and Daniel de Aubreu in a night club before Hernandez allegedly shot and killed them. Mike Pouncey (Wilfredo Lee/AP) 
A second phone call with Pouncey took place on April 28, 2015 and involved discussion of a tattoo that Hernandez wanted. The court papers quote Hernandez: 
"During this call, [Hernandez] stated words to the effect of, 'I’m going to get another tattoo that looks like a stop sign that will say, ‘Beware, no hesitation.’ [Hernandez] said, 'You feel me? Like try me and there’s no hesitation.'" 
Hernandez is accused of killing de Abreu and Furtado as retaliation for someone bumping into him and spilling a drink in a Boston club. 
Pouncey has been one of the few teammates to publicly support Hernandez since he first became a suspect in the Lloyd killing. Join the Conversation:
